body:
**Copilot GPT/Codex mismatch**
`isModernModelRef` treats all `github-copilot` models as prefix matches against `COPILOT_CLAUDE_PREFIXES`/`COPILOT_GPT_PREFIXES`, but `COPILOT_GPT_PREFIXES` omits Codex-style IDs like `gpt-5.2-codex`. As a result, `isModernModelRef({provider:"github-copilot", id:"gpt-5.2-codex"})` returns `false` even though the new test expects `true`. Either expand `COPILOT_GPT_PREFIXES` to cover `gpt-5.*`/`*-codex` variants (or reuse the existing `CODEX_MODELS` list) so the behavior matches the intended filter.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/agents/live-model-filter.ts
Line: 86:88

Comment:
**Copilot GPT/Codex mismatch**
`isModernModelRef` treats all `github-copilot` models as prefix matches against `COPILOT_CLAUDE_PREFIXES`/`COPILOT_GPT_PREFIXES`, but `COPILOT_GPT_PREFIXES` omits Codex-style IDs like `gpt-5.2-codex`. As a result, `isModernModelRef({provider:"github-copilot", id:"gpt-5.2-codex"})` returns `false` even though the new test expects `true`. Either expand `COPILOT_GPT_PREFIXES` to cover `gpt-5.*`/`*-codex` variants (or reuse the existing `CODEX_MODELS` list) so the behavior matches the intended filter.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>

**Unreachable fallback path**
This test stubs the registry so `find("github-copilot", "claude-opus-4.5")` returns a template, but the forward-compat resolver always looks up templates using `normalizeProviderId(provider)` (see `model.ts:79`/`model.ts:101`). If `normalizeProviderId("github-copilot")` differs from the literal string (e.g. normalized to `githubcopilot`), this lookup will never hit and the fallback won’t be built. Update the stub to match the normalized provider value (or stub `normalizeProviderId`) so the test is asserting the real reachable code path.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/agents/pi-embedded-runner/model.test.ts
Line: 210:214

Comment:
**Unreachable fallback path**
This test stubs the registry so `find("github-copilot", "claude-opus-4.5")` returns a template, but the forward-compat resolver always looks up templates using `normalizeProviderId(provider)` (see `model.ts:79`/`model.ts:101`). If `normalizeProviderId("github-copilot")` differs from the literal string (e.g. normalized to `githubcopilot`), this lookup will never hit and the fallback won’t be built. Update the stub to match the normalized provider value (or stub `normalizeProviderId`) so the test is asserting the real reachable code path.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>
